title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 567.5 - Award criteria
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 567.5 - Award criteria

State Regulations
(a) Special
achievements shall include, but are not limited to, individual or team efforts
that result in new products or services, improvements in quality of service to
the public, increase in revenue to the State, savings in time or operational
costs, positive changes in the image or reputation of the agency or the State, improvement in morale, etc. It is not necessary for eligible achievements to
have been accomplished on an individual's own time. An employee may or may not
have devoted unpaid hours to the achievement for which he or she is
nominated. (b) Although such
achievements must reasonably have been completed or the bulk of the work done
during the specified program year (to be defined by program guidelines), they
may also represent the culmination of efforts during an individual's entire
career. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
567.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
